snippet: General Motors reported a 7 percent gain in auto sales in the United States in February, while Ford posted a 9 percent gain and Chrysler sales rose 4 percent.
abstract: Research firm Autodata says sales of new vehicles rose modestly in Feb 2013, as American consumers continue to buy more fuel-efficient cars, and businesses, benefiting from increased home construction, replaced aging pickup trucks with newer models; General Motors reports 7 percent gain in auto sales in United States in February, while Ford posts 9 percent gain and Chrysler says sales rose 4 percent.
lead_paragraph: General Motors reported a 7 percent gain in auto sales in the United States in February, while Ford posted a 9 percent gain and Chrysler sales rose 4 percent.

headline.main: Auto Sales Rise 3.7%, Lifted by Upturn in Home Construction
headline.print_headline: Auto Sales Rise 3.7%, Lifted by Upturn in Home Construction
